document.docAuthor: Shih, Hsi-Te, Ng, Peter K. L., Fang, Shou-Hua, Chan, Benny K. K. & Wong, Kingsley J. H.
document.masterDocTitle: Diversity and distribution of fiddler crabs (Brachyura: Ocypodidae: Uca) from China, with new records from Hainan Island in the South China Sea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Diversity and distribution of fiddler crabs (Brachyura: Ocypodidae: Uca) from China, with new records from Hainan Island in the South China Sea

subSubSection.paragraph:
Uca acuta
(not
Gelasimus acutus
Stimpson, 1858
)—
Kwok & Tang 2006
: fig. 3 [ Hong Kong ].

Material examined. Zhejiang : 1 3 ( 18.91 mm ) (MBMCAS 161731 ), Yanpu, Cangnan, Wenzhou,
5 Oct. 1979
. Fujian : 2 3 ( 36.58 , 36.97 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 13378 ), Yangdai, Jingjiang, Quanzhou, coll. S.-H. Fang,
19 May 2007
. Guangdong : 1 3 ( 20.99 mm ), 1 Ƥ ( 11.6 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 13379 ), Nanao, Shantou, coll. S.-L. Yang,
6 Nov. 1988
.
Hong Kong
: 2 3 ( 16.18 , 18.83 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 13380 ), Tung Chung, coll. K. Wong & K.H. Lo,
28 Apr. 2009
. Hainan : 3 3 ( 29.58–32.13 mm ) (MBMCAS 166379 ), Dongzhai,
15 Oct. 1990
; 4 3 ( 32.52–36.89 mm ), 4 ƤƤ ( 20.91–31.14 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 13381 ), Dongzhai, coll. H.- T. Shih & J.-H. Lee,
23 Jun. 2004
.

Live coloration. Adult male is olive on the carapace and legs, with major cheliped being yellow brown (
Fig. 3
A, B). Adult female is gray, finely mottled with pale gray, on the carapace, legs are gray, and sides of carapace, merus of legs, and minor chelipeds dark purple (
Fig. 3
C, D).
Distribution. West Pacific and eastern Indian Ocean ( China , Vietnam , Thailand , Malay Peninsula, Borneo, Sumatra, Burma , Bengal).

Remarks.
Uca paradussumieri
is widely distributed in West Pacific and eastern Indian Ocean. In China , specimens were collected from Fujian, Guangdong (including Hong Kong ), and northern Hainan (see Material examined). Old records of “
U. dussumieri
” in China (see reference list above), most likely belong to
U. paradussumieri
(see Remarks under
U. dussumieri
), and its range may thus extend north to Jiangsu, East China (
Table 1
; cf.
Fig. 1
).
